project.teaser: "The Flex4fact project aims to develop an end-to-end ecosystem that takes a modular approach to enable flexible manufacturing in industry and create the conditions for the necessary energy transition in which all stakeholders can participate and benefit. Currently, complex...
project.objective: "The Flex4fact project aims to develop an end-to-end ecosystem that takes a modular approach to enable flexible manufacturing in industry and create the conditions for the necessary energy transition in which all stakeholders can participate and benefit. Currently, complex process industries and the segment of mixed clusters and distributed renewable energy flows are not covered. Indeed, at least three key elements of the Flex4Fact approach differ from current offerings: 1) enabling industrial flexibility through digital process twinning and machine learning techniques to address complex operational scenarios and exploit the full potential of the selected industrial cases; 2) the end-to-end approach of the Flex4Fact platform, covering the entire technology stack required to achieve the results; 3) a modular and multi-level approach that leverages flexible, hybrid architectures, open protocols, and standard interfaces to enable greater flexibility in the system itself and associated service offerings, remove barriers to entry for vendors in the value chain, and ensure data communication with existing IT legacy systems. As a digital enabler for flexible energy consumption, the Flex4Fact platform will meet the needs of companies of all sizes, including SMEs that are affected by rising energy prices and have less ""financial muscle"" to deploy a combination of IT, manufacturing, and energy solutions (93% of European companies have fewer than 10 employees and only 1 in 5 SMEs are highly digitized). The Flex4fact platform will also reduce the digital divide between North and Southern Europe, another crucial aspect for European competitiveness: in fact, it will be developed by a balanced European consortium in which critical technologies will be developed and implemented by several partners in five industrial contexts, from North to South in Europe."
project.title: Industrial Cluster FLEXibility platform for sustainable FACTories to reduce CO2 emissions and to enable the Energy Transition

It will provide the high-level requirements that guide subsystem development (including standards, protocols, and cybersecurity), address key functions, and document interfaces.

result.title: Model description and scope of techno-economic assessments
result.description: Modeling and scoping of the techno-economic assessments for the identified industrial settings. A mathematical model based on optimization techniques will be developed to perform the system-level techno-economic assessments.

result.title: Validation Protocols
result.description: Definition of the protocols to validate the FLEX4FACT solutions in the industrial settings.

result.title: Technical report: Hardware and software architecture design of FLEX4FACT cloud platform
result.description: Description of the hardware and software architecture of theFLEX4FACT Industrial Cluster Flexibility Platform.

result.title: Technical report: Required data definition for developing and executing the algorithms for optimizing planning and scheduling of the manufacturing processes
result.description: Definition of the required data and its granularity needed for the optimization algorithms developed in T4.2.

result.title: Technical report: models and algorithms for FLEX4FACT cluster flexibility optimization in the internal/external markets
result.description: Description of the mathematical models developed for finding the optimal solution(s)from the cluster/markets point of view, favouring the use of RESs and the self-consumption of the energy produced by RESs themselves

result.title: Communication and dissemination toolbox, incl. Website
result.description: Toolbox for communication and dissemination activities in the project. The toolbox includes branding, brochure, roll-up, templates for materials and guidelines for partners, and the project website.

result.title: System Integration Plan
result.description: Forethought of the activities for the integration of the tools for validation in the industrial settings.

result.title: Technical report: sample cases and numerical experiments to test FLEX4FACT cluster flexibility algorithms
result.description: Description of the sample cases and experiments performed to validate the cluster flexibility algorithms.

result.title: Technical report: the electricity, dispatching and ancillary services markets in FLEX4FACT countries
result.description: Description of the electricity markets, the dispatching services markets, and the ancillary services markets in those countries where the uses cases of the FLEX4FACT project are located, and the procedures to buy/sell/exchange electricity and grid services.

result.title: F1000 Research
Model Validation Results and sensitivity analysis
result.description: Description of the validation and validation results of all the models developed in Task 3.3, under different operation conditions and varying the values of the critical input parameters.

result.title: Multi-stage optimization flexibility algorithm for demand response in ancillary services. An industrial case study

result.title: Communication, dissemination and exploitation plan update
result.description: Update of the Communication, dissemination and exploitation plan

result.title: Technical report: models and algorithms for optimizing planning and scheduling of the manufacturing processes
result.description: Description of the advanced digital algorithms for planning and control of productionprocesses, used to flexibilize the industrial processes.

result.title: Technical report: sample cases and numerical experiments to test FLEX4FACT cluster flexibility optimization
result.description: Description of the sample cases and numerical experiments perfomed to validate the mathematical models for the optimal solution(s) from the cluster/markets point of view, favouring the use of RESs and the self-consumption of the energy produced by RESs themselves.

result.title: Communication, dissemination and exploitation plan
result.description: Detailed roadmap based on the input of all partners and on the draft strategydescribed in section 2.2.

result.title: Description and scope of LCA and sustainability analysis
result.description: The scope of the LCA, including the environmental impact categories to be covered, will be defined in collaboration with the project partners (using existing data sets) and will be based on the work undertaken in WP1. Describes and defines the system boundaries and the function of the study, reflecting the reasons for conducting the assessment. This will ensure consistency and comparability in the assessment of the various technologies/methods under investigation

result.title: Project promotional video
result.description: Project promotional video featuring specific FLEX4FACT solutions and highlighting use cases.

result.title: The Impact of Electricity Tariffs on Optimal Production Scheduling

details.authors: Fisco-Compte, Pau; Bullich-Massagué, Eduard; Domenech, Bruno; Juanpera, Marc; Pastor, Rafael; Ranaboldo, Matteo

result.title: Technical report: Sample case description and algorithm validation
result.description: Description and results of the sample test case to validate the flexibilization algorithms developed in tasks 4.2.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: Description of the data management policy that the Consortium will apply to its entire data cycle, including Ethics and Privacy. Overview of the data that the project is expected to generate, the types and formats of that data, and how that data will be processed and stored. This is intended to contribute to proper data handling during the lifetime of the project.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
